intro: Antimima triquetra, commonly known as the three-cornered leek, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale blue flowers. The plant grows up to 30 centimeters tall and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Antimima triquetra is also used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
